title: Haryana land deal: Robert Vadra at ED office after summon, alleges 'vendetta'
content: The Enforcement Directorate has issued a second summons to Robert Vadra, husband of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, for questioning in a money-laundering investigation related to the Shikhopur land deal in Haryana. Vadra's company, Skylight Hospitality, acquired land in Shikohpur village in 2008 and later entered into an agreement with DLF to sell the land for a significantly higher price.

title: TN CM Stalin forms high-level panel on autonomy amid rising tensions with Centre
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has announced a high-level committee, led by retired Justice Kurian Joseph, to examine state autonomy amid concerns of the Union government encroaching on state powers. The committee will study the relationship between the Union and states, focusing on transferring subjects from the Concurrent List back to the State List and addressing issues like NEET.

title: Harvard's $2.2 billion funding frozen: What triggered Trump admin’s move?
content: The Trump administration froze over $2.3 billion in federal funding to Harvard University, citing non-compliance with demands to address antisemitism and ideological bias. Harvard rejected these demands, deeming them politically motivated and an infringement on academic freedom. This action is part of a broader campaign targeting elite universities, aiming to reshape higher education and combat perceived left-leaning ideologies.

title: MS Dhoni's chat with Sanjiv Goenka sets social media on fire
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Lucknow Super Giants by five wickets. CSK's bowlers set the stage, restricting LSG to 166/7, while Dhoni and Dube's explosive batting sealed the victory. Dhoni's reunion with LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka added a nostalgic touch to the win. After the game, Dhoni was seen conversing with Goenka who once owned Rising Pune Super Giant franchise where Dhoni played for two seasons.

title: Woman attacked in mosque after husband objects to male friend visiting home
content: In Davanagere, Channagiri police arrested Mohammad Niyaz, Mohammad Gauspeer, Chand Basha, Inayat Ullah, Dastagir, and Rasool TR for allegedly attacking Shabina Banu after a video of the assault went viral. The arrests followed Shabina Banu's complaint regarding the incident that occurred after her husband disapproved of a male friend visiting her relative. The investigation, led by CPI Ravish, is ongoing.

title: Melinda Gates responds to Bill Gates statement that divorce was a regret
content: Melinda French Gates addressed her 2021 divorce from Bill Gates, deeming it "necessary" due to conflicting values within their marriage. While Bill expressed regret over the split, Melinda focused on her own well-being and happiness. She also revealed experiencing panic attacks during the separation and finding solace in therapy. Currently single, she is embracing the dating scene.

title: Priyansh Arya's heartfelt reply to Preity Zinta goes viral
content: Priyansh Arya, the 24-year-old Delhi batter, stunned Chennai Super Kings with a blistering century in IPL 2025, reaching the milestone in just 39 balls. His explosive innings, featuring seven fours and nine sixes, made him the second-fastest Indian to an IPL century. Preity Zinta's ecstatic celebration mirrored the team's joy after Arya's game-changing performance.

title: 'Kya karein, sorry': Vir Das slams AI as injured wife not provided wheelchair
content: Comedian Vir Das has publicly criticized Air India for a disappointing travel experience. Despite paying a premium for their Delhi flight, he and his wife, recovering from a foot fracture, encountered broken amenities and a lack of assistance.

title: Trump's crackdown on univs: Why elite institutions are being targeted
content: The Trump administration has frozen over $2.3 billion in federal funding to Harvard University, intensifying a broad campaign to reshape U.S. higher education. Citing civil rights violations and antisemitism, the administration is targeting elite universities with demands to eliminate DEI programs, adopt merit-based admissions, and curb campus protests. Harvard and others are pushing back, calling the moves politically driven. Legal challenges are mounting, as over 60 universities face similar scrutiny and potential penalties.

title: Google layoffs may hit these teams in India
content: Google is reportedly preparing for another round of layoffs, potentially impacting advertising, sales, and marketing teams in India, particularly in Hyderabad and Bengaluru offices. This restructuring follows recent job cuts in the Platforms and Devices division, which includes Android, Pixel, and Chrome. Google aims to streamline operations and enhance efficiency through these workforce reductions.

title: Karnataka caste census report: Lingayat Mahasabha rejects findings
content: Karnataka's government is grappling with internal discord following the leak of a caste census report. Legislators and leaders from the Vokkaliga and Lingayat communities are strongly opposing the report. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has scheduled a meeting with Congress MLAs from the Vokkaliga community. Forest minister Eshwar Khandre, a Lingayat, is gathering feedback from community leaders.

title: 'We’ll do same when Rahul comes to power': ED raids ex-Rajasthan minister's home
content: Enforcement Directorate officials raided the Jaipur residence of Congress leader Pratap Singh Khachariyawas. The action sparked political reactions, with Congress leaders alleging political motivation. Khachariyawas stated his cooperation and accused the BJP of misusing central agencies. He warned of similar actions when Congress regains power. The raid created a stir in Rajasthan's political circles.

title: Mehul Choksi owes Rs 63 lakh in maintenance dues for Mumbai flats: Report
content: Mehul Choksi, the fugitive businessman, owes approximately Rs 63 lakh in unpaid maintenance fees for his Malabar Hill flat in Mumbai, spanning over seven years. A society member reported that Choksi owns three units, including an illegally occupied terrace, and the outstanding amount could reach Rs 95 lakh with renovation costs.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: Donald Trump's push to revitalize American manufacturing through tariffs faces challenges, particularly for tech giants like Apple heavily reliant on Chinese production. Despite Apple's investment commitments and some supply chain diversification, the feasibility of large-scale iPhone manufacturing in the US remains questionable due to scale, speed, and specialized skills available overseas, as highlighted by Steve Jobs years ago.

title: Booze by mail? Now, postal service used to smuggle liquor into dry Gujarat
content: Bootleggers in Gujarat attempted a novel smuggling operation by exploiting the Indian postal service to transport liquor from Diu. They believed using postal channels would evade police scrutiny at the Diu-Gujarat border. However, police intercepted a suspect carrying liquor-filled parcels with official postal stamps, revealing the involvement of a postmaster who facilitated the scheme.

title: Trump admin’s list of demands to Harvard before freezing $2.2bn in grants
content: The Trump administration has frozen $2.2 billion in grants and a $60 million contract to Harvard University after the institution allegedly failed to meet intellectual and civil rights standards. The government demands Harvard shutter DEI programs, adopt merit-based hiring and admissions, reform international student recruitment, ensure viewpoint diversity, and combat antisemitism.

title: Market in green, Sensex jumps over 1,600 points; Nifty near 23,338
content: Indian stock markets began the week positively, with Sensex surging over 1300 points and Nifty50 also at high, marking a positive opening for the week. Optimism was fueled by potential US trade concessions and positive global cues. Investors are also awaiting corporate earnings reports, while Asian markets generally saw gains, reflecting a positive international market sentiment.

title: MS Dhoni breaks 11-year-old IPL record in style
content: MS Dhoni's vintage performance led Chennai Super Kings to a thrilling five-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL. Dhoni's unbeaten 26, along with Shivam Dube's 43*, secured the win, ending CSK's losing streak. It was Dhoni’s 16th Player of the Match award as captain, coming after a long gap of 2175 days — nearly six years.

title: Watch: The moment Blue Origin rocket lands with Katy Perry and all-women crew
content: Blue Origin's New Shepard capsule soared to space. It carried an all-women crew, including Katy Perry and others. The sub-orbital flight reached over 100 kilometers. The crew experienced weightlessness before a smooth landing in West Texas. This mission marks a milestone for women in space exploration. The capsule soared at three times the speed of sound.

title: 1st in India: Telangana effects quota within quota for SCs
content: Telangana has become the first state to implement sub-categorization of Scheduled Caste reservations, classifying 59 sub-castes into three groups. This move, coinciding with Dr. Ambedkar's 135th birth anniversary, allocates 1% reservation to Group I, 9% to Group II, and 5% to Group III.

title: Can President be forced to seek Supreme Court opinion on a bill?
content: The Supreme Court's recent judgment on presidential powers concerning state bills has sparked debate. The court suggested the President seek its opinion on a bill's constitutionality under Article 143, even though it's not mandated. This raises concerns about judicial overreach into the legislative process and the practicality of reviewing numerous state bills.

title: Trump admin freezes $2.2bn grants to Harvard university
content: Harvard University is facing a $2.2 billion funding freeze after rejecting White House mandates to combat campus anti-Semitism. President Alan Garber refused to compromise Harvard's independence, leading to the grant suspension. This follows increased campus tensions and investigations into anti-Semitic incidents.

title: MS Dhoni breaks silence, says 'God makes it very tough'
content: Chennai Super Kings broke their five-match losing streak in a thrilling victory, with MS Dhoni and Shivam Dube leading the charge. Dube's resilient innings, especially his explosive 19th over, secured the much-needed win. Dhoni acknowledged the team's struggles and hoped this victory would boost morale. The left-handed batter later shared insights into his approach, emphasising adaptability and composure.

title: Measles makes a comeback in US, 700 confirmed cases so far: Safety tips
content: A significant measles outbreak is alarming the United States, with over 700 confirmed cases after its elimination in 2000. The CDC is actively involved in containment, addressing the resurgence attributed to declining vaccination rates. Measles, a highly contagious airborne virus, poses a threat even to vaccinated individuals, though breakthrough infections remain consistent with previous years.

title: MS Dhoni's unexpected reaction: 'Why are they giving me the award?'
content: MS Dhoni's vintage performance and humility shone as Chennai Super Kings defeated Lucknow Super Giants. Despite winning Player of the Match, Dhoni credited Noor Ahmad's exceptional bowling. Dhoni's unbeaten 26 off 11 balls secured the win, while young Shaik Rasheed's impressive 27 off 19 provided a strong foundation. Rasheed’s timing and shot selection caught the eye, with his stylish strokeplay showing maturity beyond his years. Dhoni, impressed by the youngster's composure, praised his ability to play “authentic shots.”

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week
content: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends Indian Hotels and HPCL as top stock picks for the week starting April 14, 2025. IHCL's asset-light strategy and new segments are expected to drive growth, targeting a 26% adj. PAT CAGR.

title: Fresh encounter breaks out in J&K's Poonch; 1 soldier injured
content: A new encounter started between security forces and terrorists in Poonch's Lasana village. The event occurred on Monday night. Security forces initiated a search operation after receiving information about terrorist presence. One Army personnel sustained injuries during the exchange of fire. The injured personnel was promptly taken to a hospital.

title: Trump vs Harvard University: Full text of who said what
content: The Trump administration has frozen $2.2 billion in grants and $6 million in contracts to Harvard University after the institution declined to comply with policy changes suggested by the US President. These changes included sharing hiring data and ensuring viewpoint diversity across academic departments.

title: Fire at government hospital, over 200 patients evacuated in Lucknow
content: A fire erupted at Lucknow's Lokbandhu Hospital on Monday night, sparking widespread panic and the urgent evacuation of over 200 patients, including those in critical condition. The blaze, suspected to be caused by a short circuit in the women's medicine and emergency ward, rapidly filled the second floor with thick smoke.

title: Choksi extradition depends on Belgian court’s view on Indian jail condition
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi has been apprehended in Belgium based on an extradition request from Indian authorities concerning a significant banking fraud case. While this marks progress in bringing Choksi to justice, challenges remain as Belgian courts may consider human rights issues and prison conditions in India, potentially hindering extradition efforts.

title: Bueckers shares heartfelt message after Dallas Wings select her No 1 in WNBA Draft
content: Paige Bueckers, fresh off a national championship with UConn, was drafted first overall by the Dallas Wings in the WNBA. Overwhelmed with gratitude, Bueckers expressed excitement about joining the Wings and exploring Dallas. Despite a challenging college career marked by an ACL injury, she emerged stronger, leading UConn to victory.

title: ‘Good Bad Ugly’ box office collections: Ajith’s action flick mints Rs 101.30 cr
content: Ajith Kumar's action entertainer 'Good Bad Ugly' has stormed into the Rs 100 crore club within just five days of its release. The film's strong performance is driven by robust Tamil occupancy, particularly in Chennai and Madurai, while the Telugu version shows consistent, modest figures. Despite mixed reviews, the film is a celebration for Ajith fans, with callbacks to his older hits.

title: Watch: JD Vance drops trophy, jokes ‘didn’t want anyone else to get it’
content: During a White House celebration honouring the Ohio State Buckeyes' national championship, vice president JD Vance accidentally toppled the trophy, causing a stir among the team and President Trump. Despite the mishap, Coach Ryan Day considered the visit an honor, marking a final celebration before key players depart for the NFL Draft, signaling a period of transition for the team.

title: MS Dhoni and Shivam Dube end CSK's five-match losing streak
content: Chennai Super Kings snapped their five-match losing streak with a thrilling five-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, fueled by MS Dhoni and Shivam Dube's explosive partnership. Chasing 167, CSK overcame a middle-order wobble, while LSG's Rishabh Pant's half-century went in vain. Dube credited Dhoni's aggressive batting for easing the pressure during the chase.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs pleads not guilty to new sex trafficking, prostitution charges
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs pleaded not guilty to new federal sex trafficking and prostitution charges, as prosecutors expand the racketeering case against him. Accused of abusing and coercing women for two decades, Combs faces five criminal counts. The trial is set for May 5, but a delay is possible due to new evidence. Combs has been incarcerated since September 2024.

title: TCS's new COO Aarthi breaks IT glass ceiling
content: Aarthi Subramanian is poised to become TCS's first woman COO and the first woman C-suite executive at a major Indian IT firm, marking a significant milestone for gender diversity in the industry. Having served as the group chief digital officer at Tata Sons, she brings extensive experience and a deep understanding of TCS to her new role.

title: Bengali New Year 2025: 75+ Pohela Boishakh wishes, msgs & quotes to share
content: Pohela Boishakh, the Bengali New Year, is a vibrant festival celebrated with enthusiasm by Bengali communities worldwide. It marks new beginnings with traditional feasts, colorful attire, and cultural performances. People exchange warm wishes, reconnect with their roots, and enjoy delicacies like panta bhaat and ilish maach, seeking blessings for a brighter future.

title: Palestinian student Mohsen Mahdawi arrested during citizenship interview
content: Palestinian student Mohsen Mahdawi, a Columbia University activist, was detained by immigration agents during his citizenship interview in Vermont. His arrest followed his vocal participation in anti-Israel protests, raising concerns about politically motivated targeting.

title: Robots are beginning to replace maids in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru residents are increasingly opting for a maid-free life. They are using robots for cooking and cleaning. Manisha Roy replaced her cook with a kitchen robot and is happy with the decision. Meera Vasudev uses robots for cleaning. Renuka Gurunathan finds automated cleaning liberating. These technologies are also changing household dynamics. Men are now participating in household chores.

title: Congress humiliated, distorted vision of Ambedkar: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a gathering in Hisar on Ambedkar's birth anniversary, strongly criticized the Congress party for allegedly disrespecting Dr. B.R. Ambedkar during his lifetime and attempting to erase his legacy. Modi highlighted development initiatives under the BJP government, contrasting them with the performance of Congress-led administrations.

title: Bengali NY cancelled at Chittagong for 1st time in 47 years over vandalism
content: Bengali New Year celebrations in Chittagong were cancelled for the first time in 47 years after vandalism by unidentified individuals. The incident, which involved the destruction of banners and stages, led to protests and the suspension of scheduled programs.

title: What next? Dalal Street seeks direction amid tariff chaos
content: Dalal Street faces a truncated trading week influenced by tariff developments, US bond yields, FPI activity, and corporate earnings. Volatility is expected to persist despite potential easing in the US-China trade war. Investors will closely monitor Infosys, Wipro, HDFC Bank, and ICICI Bank results after TCS's underwhelming performance, alongside commodity market trends, particularly Goldman Sachs' revised gold price target.

title: Donald Trump again accuses Volodymyr Zelenskyy of starting war
content: Donald Trump has once again blamed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky for the ongoing war with Russia, despite the devastating consequences of the conflict. Trump also implicated President Biden and Putin, asserting their shared responsibility for the war's outbreak and continuation.

title: Karnataka bid to breach 50% quota cap awaits tough judicial test
content: Karnataka's potential increase in caste-based reservations faces legal challenges, mirroring the fate of similar laws in other states. While the Supreme Court deemed the 50% quota cap not entirely inflexible, it primarily applies to SC/ST/OBC reservations.

title: Britain's Indian restaurant Veeraswamy under threat of closure. But why?
content: London's historic Michelin-starred Indian restaurant, Veeraswamy, faces potential closure after nearly a century. The Crown Estate, owner of the building, plans to reclaim the space to expand office reception areas, refusing to renew the restaurant's lease. Owner Ranjit Mathrani is contesting the decision in court, fearing job losses and business disruption if forced to relocate without a suitable alternative.

title: Why isn’t it Ohtani?: Fan war continues as Aaron Judge becomes US captain
content: MLB announces Aaron Judge as Team USA Captain for the World Baseball Classic 2026. The announcement has led to mixed reviews from fans, with majority criticizing MLB's decision on choosing Judge as the captain when other capable players were still active. Meanwhile, fan war between Judge's fans and Ohtani's fans continue to happen on social media.

title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's WNBA draft performance
content: Dallas, with Paige Bueckers at No. 1, and Washington, which got Sonia Citron at No. 3, got high marks in the WNBA draft.

title: 'It was Paige and Paige only': Wings land Bueckers
content: Paige Bueckers, coming off leading UConn to its first national championship in nine years, was selected No. 1 by the Dallas Wings in the 2025 WNBA draft Monday night.

title: Ward one of 17 to attend NFL draft; no Sanders
content: Miami quarterback Cam Ward, the projected No. 1 pick in the 2025 NFL draft, is one of 17 players confirmed to attend the event in Green Bay, Wisconsin.

title: Former NFL TE Hasselbeck, father of QBs, dies
content: Former NFL tight end Don Hasselbeck, who won a Super Bowl in his nine-year career and was the father of two NFL quarterbacks, died Monday. He was 70.

title: VP Vance fumbles Buckeyes' championship trophy
content: Vice President JD Vance ended the Ohio State football team's visit to the White House on Monday by fumbling the team's national championship trophy.

title: Source: Sharks' Couture unable to continue career
content: The San Jose Sharks scheduled a Tuesday news conference, where the club and captain Logan Couture will announce the veteran center can't continue his playing career because of injury, a source told ESPN's Emily Kaplan on Monday, confirming a report.

title: Skenes, Davis form 1st battery of MLB No. 1 picks
content: In the Pirates' 10-3 win over the Nationals on Monday night, Pittsburgh starter Paul Skenes teamed up with catcher Henry Davis to become the first pitcher/catcher battery in major league history comprised of players selected No. 1 in the draft.

title: Sources: Cal RB Ott, '23 All-Pac-12, enters portal
content: Cal running back Jaydn Ott, a first-team All-Pac-12 selection in 2023, entered the transfer portal on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Smith 'running it back' for senior year at Purdue
content: Purdue guard Braden Smith, a consensus first-team All-American who averaged 15.8 points and 8.7 assists, which was second in Division I, will return for his senior season.

title: From Paige Bueckers to Hailey Van Lith: Best dressed stars from the 2025 WNBA draft
content: Paige Bueckers and Kiki Iriafen took the orange carpet by storm at the 2025 WNBA draft in New York City. Here are the best fits from the night.

title: Angel Reese reacts to being reunited with LSU teammate Hailey Van Lith
content: Chicago Sky teammates Angel Reese and Hailey Van Lith spent the 2023-24 season playing together at LSU.

title: Who are the most fun teams to watch this season? Let's rank all 30
content: Star power, mammoth home runs and ... cotton candy fries? Here are baseball's most exciting squads for 2025.

title: Winners and losers from the Masters, plus predictions for the rest of this year's majors
content: From Rory McIlroy to early favorites for the final three majors of the golf season, we look at five big questions coming out of Augusta and looking forward to the rest of the 2025 season.

title: From 'Ted Lasso' appearances to honest talks about being fired: Inside Pete Carroll's USC class
content: This spring, in addition to being named head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders, Carroll has been moonlighting as a college professor.

title: NBA experts' picks for Warriors-Grizzlies and every play-in showdown
content: Our NBA experts pick which teams make it out of the play-in tournament and which will survive the first round.

title: NBA coaching carousel: What's next for the Suns, Nuggets, Grizzlies and Kings jobs?
content: Which NBA coaching jobs are available? Which situations are the most appealing? Tim Bontemps breaks down the vacancies.

title: 30 years after Ki-Jana Carter went No. 1, Ashton Jeanty can help RBs regain draft prominence
content: Running backs are cool again in the NFL, and they're the strongest position group in this class. But will a running back get picked first ever again?

title: How high would Ohio State's Jeremiah Smith go in this draft? We asked NFL insiders
content: Smith won't be eligible for the draft until 2027, but the league is already excited about his talent.

title: Szczesny: Will accept No. 2 role if Flick wishes
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny said on Monday he will accept being dropped for Marc-André ter Stegen if that is what coach Hansi Flick decides.

title: 'Madrid is Madrid': Marcelo warns Arsenal
content: Real Madrid legend Marcelo has said the club cannot be written off as they look to overturn a 3-0 deficit against Arsenal in the Champions League on Wednesday.

title: Slow CWC ticket sales don't worry FIFA's Infantino
content: ATLANTA -- FIFA President Gianni Infantino said he is not concerned about ticket sales for this summer's Club World Cup in the United States despite questions about how well the 32-team event is selling across the country.

title: Heartbreak for Brady as Birmingham lose in final
content: Birmingham City were dealt a shock 2-0 defeat by Peterborough United in the Vertu Trophy final at Wembley Stadium on Sunday, with NFL legend and minority owner of the club Tom Brady watching on.

title: Villa say Rashford, Watkins partnership 'next step'
content: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery suggested he is not ready to unleash Marcus Rashford and Ollie Watkins as a strike partnership against Paris Saint-Germain in the <a...

title: McTominay guides Napoli to big win in Serie A race
content: Napoli cruised to a 3-0 win over relegation-threatened Empoli on Monday with Scott McTominay and Romelu Lukaku leading the charge as the hosts kept pace with Serie A leaders Inter Milan.

title: Garang Kuol eyes summer exit from Newcastle
content: Socceroos winger Garang Kuol has told ESPN that he needs to move away from Newcastle United in the next transfer window to secure first-team football.

title: Van Dijk expects 'a big summer' at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has hinted it will be a "big summer" for the club as they look to build on a successful debut season under Arne Slot.

title: Real Madrid, Mbappe's malaise, Man United adrift, Bayern's Der Klassiker lessons, more
content: Mbappe's red card punctuated another bad Madrid outing -- not good ahead of the second leg with Arsenal. Elsewhere, Bayern learned a lot from Der Klassiker and Man United look completely lost, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: MLS Power Rankings: New No. 1 Vancouver proves it's for real
content: While Miami sputtered vs. Chicago, Vancouver jumped to No. 1 in our MLS Power Rankings by demolishing Austin.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd eye €30m move for Schick
content: Is Patrik Schick the man to solve Manchester United's goal-scoring woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: Who will new featherweight title-holder Volkanovski fight in his first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility? Let's talk about matchups after UFC 314.

title: Did Lewis Hamilton have a breakthrough with Ferrari in Bahrain?
content: Lewis Hamilton has struggled to adapt to his new home at Ferrari, but he might have turned a corner in Bahrain.

title: Tejashwi Yadav meets Congress leadership in Delhi ahead of Mahagatbandhan meet in Patna
content: When asked about Mahagatbandhan’s Bihar CM face, Mr. Yadav told reporters, ‘don’t be in a hurry to speculate.’ He further indicated that this was just a preliminary conversation

title: Gujarat man who sent death threat to Salman Khan turns out to be mentally ill
content: Mumbai police issue notice to mentally unstable man threatening Salman Khan, tightens security at his residence

title: India Justice Report 2025: Not a single State/UT meets their own reserved quotas for women in police force
content: IJR 2025 also said that about 17% of police stations in the country do not have a single CCTV, while 3 in 10 police stations do not have women help desks.

title: Truckers’ strike in Karnataka halts lorry movement through Erode’s Dhimbam Ghat Road
content: The strike, announced demanding rollback of the recent diesel price hike and reduction in toll charges, brought the movement of goods to a standstill.

title: Telangana on path to make one crore women ‘crorepatis’: Deputy CM Vikramarka
content: We pray to women as goddesses but also try to control, monitor and dictate them: Deputy CM points at contradiction

title: The necessity for, and the challenges that lie in caring for India’s elderly population
content: While the availability of geriatric care is steadily improving, health is not the only concern: elderly citizens as elderly face numerous social and economic challenges too, say experts

title: 3 killed, 19 injured as truck hits bus in Maharashtra's Buldhana
content: The Madhya Pradesh Transport bus was going from Amravati in Maharashtra to Burhanpur in MP when a truck hit it at Amsari fata

title: Kerala Forest Minister orders probe into death of two tribals in suspected wild elephant attack in Athirappilly
content: Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan blames the deaths on Forest department’s ‘lack of zeal’ in forecasting and mitigating human-wildlife conflict situations

title: ED raids premises of Rajasthan Congress leader Pratap Singh Khachariyawas, others
content: About 15 premises, including the politician’s house in Jaipur, are being searched by the federal probe agency. A security team of the CRPF has also been deployed.

title: K.K. Ragesh appointed new CPI(M) Kannur district secretary
content: Change was necessitated following relocation of CPI(M) leader M.V. Jayarajan to party’s State secretariat

title: Telangana Congress rejects PM Modi’s comments on Kancha Gachibowli lands, questions BJP’s ‘poor’ environmental track record
content: The Congress claimed that the BJP government has bulldozed forests in the name of development. Over 3 lakh hectares of forests cleared since 2014, and 99% of forest clearance applications approved without rejections

title: Question of accommodating TTV, OPS will be jointly addressed by BJP, AIADMK: Nainar Nagenthran
content: On the remark made by him—when he took over as the BJP Tamil Nadu unit chief on April 12—that he could only be a breeze while K. Annamalai worked like a storm

title: How Harvard Reacted To Trump's Diktat That Led To Fund Freeze
content: Last Friday, the Trump Administration sent a letter to Harvard University--an institution 140 years older than the United States-- asking it to end its diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives in hiring, admissions, and programs.

title: Robert Vadra, Summoned For 2nd Time, Marches To Probe Agency ED Office
content: Businessman Robert Vadra - Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's husband and brother-in-law of Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi - marched to the ED's Delhi office Tuesday morning after receiving a second summons.

title: "It Was Necessary": Melinda Gates Opens Up About Her Divorce
content: Melinda French Gates has opened up on her 2021 divorce from Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, calling the split "necessary."

title: 'Hospital Where Newborn Is Lost Must Lose Licence': Top Court's Tough Talk
content: If a newborn goes missing from the hospital, the first step should be to cancel the hospital's licence, the Supreme Court said today as it expressed anguish over cases of child trafficking and issued guidelines to tackle this menace.

title: Union Minister Gadkari Promises June Completion Of Mumbai-Goa Highway
content: Union minister Gadkari has said the long-delayed Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed by June this year, which is expected to bring relief to daily commuters and Konkan-bound travelers who have endured years of pothole-ridden roads.

title: US Grounds Helicopter Tour Company After Fatal Crash That Killed Siemens CEO
content: A Spanish business executive, his wife and three children died along with the pilot when the helicopter operated by New York Helicopter Tours malfunctioned and plunged into the Hudson River on Thursday.

title: US Citizen Mistakenly Told To "Leave" Country. She Is Immigration Lawyer
content: A Massachusetts-born immigration attorney was shocked to receive a government email telling her to leave the country, despite being a US citizen.

title: No Evidence Technology Causes "Digital Dementia" In Older Adults: Study
content: Generative artificial intelligence (AI) is the latest newcomer, with chatbots and other AI tools changing how we learn and creating considerable philosophical and legal challenges regarding what it means to "outsource thinking".

title: Eliminating Masks To 'Woke' Ideology: What Trump Wants From US Universities
content: The latest Ivy League to fall prey to Trump's crackdown was Harvard University - to which the White House put a $2.2 billion freeze in federal funding.

title: Donald Trump Hints At U-Turn On Auto Tariffs: "Some Car Companies Need Time To..."
content: Asian stocks edged slightly higher on Tuesday as some stability returned to markets, as US President Donald Trump floated a potential pause in auto-related, giving a boost to the sector after last week's rollercoaster ride.

title: Tesla Protesters' Poster Says "Send Musk To Mars", He Responds
content: The US, Canada, Europe, and other countries have recently witnessed massive protests against Elon Musk and his electric car company, Tesla.

title: Who Is Mohsen Mahdawi, Palestinian Student Detained At Citizenship Interview
content: A Palestinian student at Columbia University has become the second individual from the institution in recent weeks to be detained by US immigration authorities.

title: "Set An Example": Barack Obama As Harvard Rejects Trump's Demands
content: The US government has frozen $2.2 billion in Harvard University's federal funding for rejecting Donald Trump's demands.

title: DMK vs Tamil Nadu Governor Again, This Time Over Crimes Against Dalits
content: Less than a week after the Supreme Court pulled him up for blocking Bills, Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has targeted the MK Stalin-led DMK government over atrocities against Dalits

title: Government Colleges Mushroom In Madhya Pradesh With More Staff Than Students
content: Just 14 kilometers from Madhya Pradesh's capital, Bhopal, stands Phanda Government College - not as a symbol of higher education, but as a metaphor for the rot in the state's public college system.

title: Sensex Rallies 1,500 Points, Trump's Tariff Relief Hint Boosts Auto Stocks
content: Indian equities rallied over 2% this morning - following its Asian peers - as Donald Trump hinted at relief from steep tariffs in the automobile sector.

title: Karnataka CM to initiate development projects worth ₹492 crore in Kalaburagi on April 16
content: Mr. Siddaramaiah, along with AICC President Mallikarjun Kharge and Deputy CM D. K. Shivakumar, will attend the divisional-level job fair organised at KCT Engineering College in Kalaburagi on April 16

title: Robert Vadra appears before ED for questioning in Haryana land deal case
content: This is nothing but political vendetta. Whenever I speak for minorities they try to stop me, crush us... they tried to stop Rahul (Gandhi) in Parliament too. This is misuse of agencies and this is political vendetta, says Robert Vadra

title: Fresh encounter breaks in J&K’s Poonch, forces launch operation
content: Additional troops have been inducted, and search operations are ongoing to prevent the terrorists from escaping, says Army

title: Pregnant woman delivers on train
content: The mother and baby were handed over to the Railway Protection Force (RPF) for further medical care and transport

title: Woman strangled to death in Wayanad
content: Husband accused of the murder admitted to Kozhikode Medical College Hospital with deep cuts on his wrist

title: A.P. Minister warns of strict action against rice millers for troubling farmers
content: The government is ensuring that paddy farmers receive the price of their produce within 24 hours of procurement, says Manohar

title: People have right to protest, not to take law into their hands: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
content: Mamata Banerjee said that some people not only criticise her because she visits programmes of various religions, but also change her surname

title: Isolated rains and thunderstorms may continue in A.P. until April 20
content: Mylavaram and Sunkesula in Kadapa district, Kalumala Doddi and Katikapalli in Chittoor, Boyalakuntla in Nandyal district received rain between 10 mm and 30 mm on Monday

title: A.P. cracks the whip on illicit liquor trade along inter-State borders
content: The ‘Navodayam 2.0’ initiative has resulted in seizures, destruction of illegal liquor, and dismantling of brewing units along the borders with Odisha, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka

title: CM Naidu, Lokesh pay rich tributes to Dr. Ambedkar
content: In a post on social media platform X, Mr. Naidu said that one must take inspiration from Dr. Ambedkar’s life.

title: After Shinde, Fadnavis now encroaching on Ajit Pawar’s ministry: Rohit Pawar
content: Praveen Pardeshi was recently appointed as Chief Economic Advisor whose job functions will include preparing reports on State finances, collaborating with NITI Aayog, and pushing initiatives for green energy

title: Yogi announces State anti-poverty scheme to be named after Ambedkar
content: Akhilesh resolves to establish ‘reign of social justice’ on Ambedkar’s anniversary; Mayawati says ‘bad days’ are on for Dalits

title: Pushkar Singh Dhami felicitated by Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Mahamanch for implementing UCC
content: Dhami says Ambedkar believed true equality in society was not possible until every citizen of the country was granted equal rights

title: Judge Cites BR Ambedkar's "Interest Of Nation" Remark Amid Waqf Protests
content: In his address on the 134th Birth Anniversary of BR Ambedkar in Delhi, Justice Gavai also spoke about BR Ambedkar's views on the power balance between the Centre and states.

title: PM Modi Celebrates Bengali New Year 1432 With Warm Wishes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday extended warm greetings on the occasion of 'Poila Boishakh' which marks the beginning of Bengali New Year 1432.

title: Are Twins Allergic To The Same Things? Here's What Researchers Says
content: Allergies, whether spring sneezes due to pollen or trouble breathing triggered by a certain food, are caused by a combination of someone's genes and the environment they live in.

title: Meghalaya bags two top awards for work on Aadhaar
content: The recognition from the UIDAI came a day after anti-Aadhaar protestors hit the streets of the State’s capital Shillong

title: Amid ‘GPS spoofing’ claims, IAF says Myanmar ‘missions were achieved’ as planned
content: Global Positioning System spoofing is considered to be a form of cyberattack that includes generating false GPS signals to mislead an aircraft

title: Karnataka caste census report: Removal of exemption of ‘creamy layer’ concept for most backward classes termed ‘unfair’
content: Category 1-A has 46 castes/ sub castes from nomadic and semi nomadic castes identified by Karnataka in 1966

title: Jon Lee Anderson’s biography of Che Guevara released in Tamil
content: The two-volume translation captures the evolution of the greatest revolutionary and Marxist of the 20th Century and introduces him as a man with vulnerable moments, fears, and shortcomings

title: DMK government will always strive to ensure a bright future for Adi Dravidars and Tribal communities: Stalin
content: Speaking at an event held to commemorate Ambedkar’s birth anniversary, he says democracy has taken root across all domains through the transformation achieved by the Dravidian movement

title: Blast in firecracker unit: police, firemen, and local residents play pivotal role in rescue operation
content: Swift action in securing the large stock of firecrackers and raw materials stored on the premises prevented the fire from spreading further

title: Tamil Nadu Police issue notice to the IndiaMart portal for facilitating illegal sale of scheduled drugs
content: The police took the action following the arrest of at least 10 youth who had procured scheduled drugs illegally through the portal and seizure of more than 10,000 tablets at Sriperumbudur and Oragadam in Kancheepuram district recently

title: On Ambedkar Jayanti, Tejashwi visits house of Dalit man, terms BJP a ‘feudal party’
content: He also alleged that the BJP was continuously trying to weaken the ideology and Constitution of Baba Saheb

title: On Ambedkar Jayanti, a 40-year-old cry for justice
content: After their lands in Navi Mumbai were acquired for a port township project over 40 years ago, the residents have been living in a transit camp; their fight for rehabilitation has been continuing and they have now sought a CID probe into the reasons for the delay in their rehabilitation

title: Indian agencies approached Belgium for Mehul Choksi’s extradition in October 2024
content: The Enforcement Directorate has so far attached and seized assets worth ₹2,566 crore in connection with the investigation against the Punjab National Bank scam case “mastermind”

title: Illegal seawalls and private buildings under construction on poromboke land in Muttukadu
content: Despite complaints from environmental activists and fisherfolk, construction continues on poromboke land classified as ‘No Development Zone’ as per local level draft Coastal Zone Management Plan map

title: Forensic samples received by government labs can be analysed by private labs too: Home Minister
content: Every year, around 36,000 students will graduate from National Forensic Sciences University (NFSU), many of whom will go on to work in private forensic laboratories too, says Amit Shah

title: PNB loan fraud case: Mehul Choksi was arrested from hospital, has filed ‘freedom request’ on health grounds
content: Fugitive businessman’s lawyer in India says the plea in Belgium says probe can continue without the need for Mr. Choksi’s custody; says his client is suffering from cancer and was kidnapped and tortured in 2021

title: CDSCO upgrades its online registration system for medical devices
content: The move is aimed at improving ease of doing business and streamlining the regulatory process for manufacturers

title: Major banks cut lending, deposit rates following RBI’s repo rate cut
content: India’s largest lender State Bank of India and the largest private sector bank HDFC Bank cut their deposit interest rates by 25 basis points

title: Senior Babus transferred, waiting IAS officials get postings in Andhra Pradesh
content: Senior IAS officer Ram Prakash Sisodia transferred to Handloom and Textiles, sparking debate among bureaucrats in Secretariat

title: Union Social Justice Minister calls Ambedkar a staunch nationalist
content: Union Minister Virendra Kumar spoke of how Ambedkar refused offers from Christian missionaries and Muslim leaders, and embraced Buddhism instead, when he began his search for a new religion

title: Wealthy Indians under-reporting their income to avoid taxes: study
content: A paper by Delhi School of Economics director Ram Singh points to anomalies and assesses how their income fares against their wealth

title: WB violence: With broken homes, vandalised shops people face uncertain future
content: Hundreds of people take shelter in camps in adjoining Malda district, in Murshidabad violence signs of violence evident on streets

title: Bhu Bharati portal to provide permanent solution to land issues: CM Revanth Reddy
content: The Congress government introduced the new Record of Rights (ROR) Act to ensure land rights for every genuine individual in the State, the Chief Minister said

title: Pashupati Paras’s RLJP quits NDA
content: “I along with my party’s five MPs have quit NDA today. I’ve been with the NDA since 2014 and even won six seats in 2019 Lok Sabha poll but later the NDA did injustice with us…you media persons know it all”, Mr. Paras told The Hindu

title: Trump administration’s drastic changes a cause for concern for Indian students in U.S.
content: Education counsellors and foreign education consultants however say that while it is unlikely for students who are already pursuing courses to be affected, many new PhD applications are being rejected.

title: Rally held to condemn Waqf Act on Ambedkar’s birth anniversary
content: Bike and car rally in Adilabad protests Waqf Act and celebrates Ambedkar’s birth anniversary, led by MLC Amir Ali Khan

title: Belgium authorities confirm India’s extradition request after Mehul Choksi’s arrest
content: Choksi is wanted, along with his nephew Nirav Modi, in a case by PNB alleging loan frauds worth more than ₹13,578 crore; Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal said the arrest was a victory of the government’s diplomacy

title: Congress, AAP spar in Punjab as police book Opposition leader Bajwa
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann hits back at the Congress, asks leaders of Opposition parties to refrain from engaging in “politics of threat and terror”.

title: Tribal man trampled to death by wild elephant in Kerala’s Thrissur
content: The body of the 20-year-old victim has been taken to the Government Hospital in Chalakkudi for a post-mortem

title: Southern Railway says loco pilot was not denied leave, records show otherwise
content: Contrary to the claims of the Southern Railway CPRO, official records reveal the leave application of the loco pilot was rejected despite the employee clearly mentioning that his wife had been admitted to hospital for delivery

title: Phone Mitra: A lifeline for homesick students Telangana Social Welfare Residential Institutions
content: Through ‘Project Mitra’, students can access a structured psychological support service of headmasters and teaching staff who have been trained as ‘mental health warriors’

title: Working groups of taskforce set up by Supreme Court to identify causes of student suicides
content: National Task Force forms working groups to address student mental health concerns and prevent deaths in higher education institutions.

title: Truckers’ strike against price rise begins; movement of goods across Karnataka likely to be hit
content: Barring milk delivery vehicles, all other goods carriers, including those transporting fuel, LPG, construction material, and essentials, will remain off the roads

title: Murdered girl suspected to be sexually abused, accused said to have been intoxicated
content: The victim’s family members carried out her funeral rites after the body was handed over to them following post-mortem in Hubballi

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu slams critics of ‘P4’ initiative, reiterates commitment to eliminating economic inequalities
content: Highlighting the transformative impact of the programme in empowering the poor, the Chief Minister lauds the entrepreneurs and industrialists who have stepped forward to support the cause

title: ASI seeks to shed new light on Dwarka through underwater expeditions, scientific analysis of recovered antiquities
content: The new study by the ASI has undertaken onshore and offshore expedition at Dwarka and Beyt Dwarka in Gujarat to search, document and study submerged archaeological remains in the place as well as ascertain the antiquity of the recovered objects through scientific analysis of sediments, archaeological and marine deposits

title: Nasa's Indian-origin DEI chief sacked after Donald Trump's order
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu reinstates Ambedkar Overseas Education Scheme in Andhra Pradesh

title: 'It's the best day of my golfing life': Rory McIlroy finally gets his green jacket
content: Rory McIlroy ends his long wait for a fifth major title and completes a career grand slam with a dramatic playoff victory over Justin Rose . he had walked up the final fairway not once but twice and fending off multiple players and overcoming his mistakes during an emotional 19 holes of golf . on Sunday, with the pressure of an 11-year major drought on his shoulders, Augusta's roars were prepared to serenade him during his breakthrough .

title: How the standings can shift with Monday's six games
content: the six games taking place on tuesday are scheduled for the end of the regular season . 14 of 16 clubs have punched their tickets, though a variety of seeds remain in contention . a win by the Columbus Blue Jackets on Sunday kept them in the playoff race for at least one more day .

title: Volkanovski is back, Pimblett shines -- again
content: Alexander Volkanovski defeated Diego Lopes by unanimous decision to win the featherweight championship . yair Rodriguez revived his career with an impressive performance to ruin Patricio Pitbull's debut . "Old Man Volk" is champion once again but the division is a lot different than the one he reigned over .

title: Postseason bracket first look: X factors, best-case scenarios, big questions
